The Moss Globe Gazette

I am Dr. Rook Floss, former dentist, current publisher, and the only editor inside a sealed glass weather event. I started this paper after the City Council removed my drill privileges for "biting back at criticism." Every edition still includes one civic headline and one mandatory flossing diagram. That is journalism. That is care.

Publisher's oath, stamped in sap
  • I print facts first, molars second.
  • I retract only under anesthesia.
  • Moss on the front page means verified.

Office hours: dawn to dusk, unless the globe gets shaken by teenagers again.

Official Press Release

Regarding Allegations That The Gazette Is "Too Personal"

My former dental board claims I use this paper to "settle emotional scores with urban planning." This is false. I settle emotional scores with editorials, sourcing, and occasionally a cartoon strip where potholes speak. The Gazette remains committed to hard facts, soft moss, and the principle that every public meeting deserves an accurate transcript and at least one stern diagram of proper flossing posture.

Signed, Dr. Rook Floss, Publisher-in-Residence, Moss Globe Gazette, License #REVOKED-BUT-EARNEST.
